thread.section_title: Apartment Therapy | Saving the world, one room at a time
thread.title: Real Life Decorating: Ideas From Our House Tours That Cost Next to Nothing
thread.title_full: Real Life Decorating: Ideas From Our House Tours That Cost Next to Nothing

author: Dabney Frake
title: Real Life Decorating: Ideas From Our House Tours That Cost Next to Nothing
text:
(Image credit: Carmen Chavarri ) 
The wall above Catherine and Lionel's bed is decorated with a quartet of scarves, none of which are framed. It still looks homey and colorful. (Image credit: Marcia Prentice ) 
A white bulletin board in Jennifer's dining room is a great backdrop for a rotating gallery of children's art. Kids see their work displayed proudly and parents get inexpensive decor. (Image credit: Julia Brenner ) 
Claire and Luke solved two problems when they hung a guitar in their living room. Every day objects make for great art, and the wall is a good place for storage. 
By painting one small wall a shocking pink, Bernadette made a huge statement in her bathroom. 
Re-edited from a post originally published 1.23.16-NT
